intro: Burmeistera xerampelina var. nuda, commonly known as the naked burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of 1 to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners in tropical and subtropical regions.
